title: SoC RTVF 479-0-20 Seminar: Studies in Film and Video Prod

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Learning objectives: The first portion of this course is focused on documentary cinematography, lighting and sound. Using the Canon C100 camera, students will learn the technical and aesthetic challenges and opportunities of shooting non-fiction.



The second portion of the course will center on the basic theoretical, organizational, and practical aspects of editing documentary - using Avid Media Composer.



By the end of the course, students will have a practical grasp of shooting and editing workflows using each of these technologies and they will be able to communicate in the language of cinematography.



Evaluation method: Class participation & discussion, partnered collaboration, readings, shooting & editing assignments.



Class materials: The Shut Up and Shoot Documentary Guide (2nd Ed.), by Anthony Q. Artis.; Additional texts TBD.



2TB Thunderbolt or USB 3.0 external drive. Add'l backup drive strongly recommended.



Class notes: Registration is reserved for Documentary Media MFA Students.
